node.title: COVID-19 world latest: Millions of faulty antigen tests recalled, Russian deaths hit new high
node.description: Here's the latest from around the world overnight.
node.content: ["Here's the latest from around the world overnight.", "US", "The US Food and Drug Administration classified the recall of Ellume's over-the-counter COVID-19 home test as Class 1, the most serious type of recall, after the Australian diagnostic test maker removed some of its tests from the market last month.", "Ellume had cited higher-than-acceptable false positive test results for SARS-CoV-2 as the reason for the recall.", "Over 900,000 US children aged five-11 are expected to have received their first COVID-19 vaccine shot by the end of Wednesday, White House COVID-19 coordinator Jeff Zients said, as the Government ramped up vaccinations of younger children. COVID-19 is the largest vaccine-preventable killer of children in that age group.", "The seven-day average of total COVID-19 cases in the US was flat at about 73,300 over the past week, she said, with the hospitalisation rate also flat at 5000 a day. The seven-day average of daily deaths fell 11 percent to around 1000 per day.", "Russia", "Russia on Wednesday reported a record 1239 deaths from COVID-19 in the previous 24 hours, two days after most of its regions emerged from a week-long workplace shutdown designed to curb the spread of the virus.", "Italy", "Italy reported 60 coronavirus-related deaths on Wednesday against 68 the day before, the health ministry said, while the daily tally of new infections rose to 7891 from 6032.", "Italy has registered 132,551 deaths linked to COVID-19 since its outbreak emerged in February last year, the second-highest toll in Europe after Britain and the ninth-highest in the world.", "Ukraine", "Mistrust in vaccines is widespread in Ukraine. Several years ago it led to an outbreak of measles and today it puts thousands in hospital with COVID.", "Health minister Viktor Lyashko said on Wednesday that 92 percent of COVID patients in Ukrainian hospitals are unvaccinated and the country could have a third fewer deaths every day if its vaccination rate matched the European average.", "UK", "Britain reported 39,329 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday and 214 more deaths within 28 days of a positive test, official data showed.", "Germany", "Germany's Robert Koch Institute public health authority reported 39,676 new COVID-19 cases, a record for the third day in a row. The total number of deaths increased by 236 to 96,963.", "It also reported a rise in the coronavirus seven-day incidence rate - the number of people per 100,000 to be infected over the last week - to the highest level since the start of the pandemic, also a record for the third day in a row.", "Czechia and Slovakia", "The Czech Republic and Slovakia reported fresh surges in coronavirus infections on Wednesday and again had to start limiting non-urgent hospital care to cater for admissions of COVID-19 patients.", "Slovakia, a country of 5.5 million, reported a record high 7055 new cases for Tuesday, and the Czech Republic, twice the size, reported 14,539 cases, not far from an all-time peak seen in January.", "Indonesia and Malaysia agreed to introduce a travel corridor between them on a gradual basis, starting with key areas like capital cities and the holiday island of Bali.", "South Korea", "South Korea encouraged its citizens to take COVID-19 booster shots on Wednesday, as more of the elderly fell ill and reported vaccine breakthrough infections, driving serious and critical cases to a record.", "New Zealand", "Shops and malls in New Zealand's biggest city Auckland flung their doors open for the first time in three months on Wednesday as the city, which is at the epicentre of the country's coronavirus outbreak, gradually reopened.", "Severe coronavirus cases jumped from the mid-300s in October to 460 on Wednesday, official data showed.\u00a0", "A tiny gatecrasher twice grabbed centre stage from Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern as she updated the nation on curbs being enforced to combat COVID-19.", "\"You're meant to be in bed, darling ... Pop back to bed, I'll come and see you in a second,\" Ardern told her daughter Neve after the toddler's voice interrupted her mother's Facebook livestream off camera.", "Neve interjected again some time later, persuading Ardern it was time to end the Monday evening broadcast.", "\"I think I've covered everything that I wanted to share at this point anyway.\" she concluded.", "Thailand", "Thailand will set aside up to 500,000 doses of COVID-19 vaccines for foreign workers as it prepares to welcome them back to the country to help ease a labour shortage, a government minister said on Wednesday.", "Vietnam", "Vietnam will by the end of this month have sufficient vaccines to cover its population against COVID-19, a deputy Prime Minister said on Wednesday.", "Guinea", "Guinea began vaccinating children aged 12-17 against COVID-19 with a consignment of Pfizer and Moderna vaccines on Wednesday. Most African countries have been reliant on the COVAX vaccine sharing initiative for doses, and have inoculated only a small fraction of their populations.", "British researchers said on Wednesday they had identified proteins in the coronavirus that are recognised by T-cells of people who are exposed to the virus but resist infection, possibly providing a new target for vaccine developers.", "Merck and partner Ridgeback Biotherapeutics said on Wednesday the Japanese government will pay about US$1.2 billion for 1.6 million courses of their COVID-19 antiviral pill molnupiravir.", "Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Wednesday the United States has brokered a deal between Johnson & Johnson and the COVAX vaccine-sharing program for the delivery of the company's COVID-19 vaccine to people living in conflict zones.", "The European Union's drug regulator expects to decide in about two months on whether to allow the use of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine in children aged six to 11 years, it said on Wednesday, after the US drugmaker sought approval.", "French company Valneva's shares jumped more than 20 percent after it won approval from the European Commission for a deal under which it would supply up to 60 million doses of VLA2001, its inactivated vaccine candidate, over two years.", "Reuters / Newshub."]
